note: A disease outbreak is endemic in a country if it is consistently present in the country. "Previously reported cases" means that at least one locally transmitted case has been reported, but the whole transmission cycle has not been demonstrated in the country.
title: Countries where visceral leishmaniasis is endemic
subtitle: [Leishmaniasis](#dod:leishmaniasis) is a disease caused by parasites. In the visceral form, the parasites affect the liver, spleen, and bone marrow, causing symptoms such as fever, weight loss, anemia, and swelling of these organs.
